parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: An arbitrary name used as the identity of the resource.

parameters.name: section
parameters.doc: The name of the section in the ini file in which the setting should be defined.

parameters.name: setting
parameters.doc: The name of the setting to be defined.

parameters.name: path
parameters.doc: The ini file Puppet will ensure contains the specified setting.

parameters.name: key_val_separator
parameters.doc: The separator string to use between each setting name and value. Defaults to " = ", but you could use this to override e.g. whether or not the separator should include whitespace.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: The value of the setting to be defined.

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: An arbitrary name used as the identity of the resource.

parameters.name: section
parameters.doc: The name of the section in the ini file in which the setting should be defined.

parameters.name: setting
parameters.doc: The name of the setting to be defined.

parameters.name: subsetting
parameters.doc: The name of the subsetting to be defined.

parameters.name: subsetting_separator
parameters.doc: The separator string between subsettings. Defaults to " "

parameters.name: path
parameters.doc: The ini file Puppet will ensure contains the specified setting.

parameters.name: key_val_separator
parameters.doc: The separator string to use between each setting name and value. Defaults to " = ", but you could use this to override e.g. whether or not the separator should include whitespace.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: The value of the subsetting to be defined.

parameters.name: source
parameters.doc: source file to use for app. Must be tar tar.gz or gz file

parameters.name: tmp_fs
parameters.doc: temporary filesystem to use for app.

properties.name: enabled
properties.doc: enable/disable app

properties.name: visible
properties.doc: app is visible/invisible to users

parameters.name: host
parameters.doc: the resolvable hostname of the authentication server

properties.name: sslenabled
properties.doc: should SSL be enabled ?

properties.name: port
properties.doc: portnumber to be used

properties.name: binddn
properties.doc: the DN to use to bind to the authentication server

properties.name: binddnpassword
properties.doc: the password to the bindDN

properties.name: userbasedn
properties.doc: the base dn under wich the users can be found. Multiple values can be specified as array

properties.name: userbasefilter
properties.doc: This is the LDAP search filter you wish to use when searching for users.

properties.name: usernameattribute
properties.doc: This is the user entry attribute whose value is the username.

properties.name: realnameattribute
properties.doc: This is the user entry attribute whose value is their real name (human readable).

properties.name: groupmappingattribute
properties.doc: This is the user entry attribute whose value is used by group entries to declare membership.

properties.name: groupbasedn
properties.doc: This is the distinguished names of LDAP entries whose subtrees contain the groups.

properties.name: groupbasefilter
properties.doc: The LDAP search filter Splunk uses when searching for static groups

properties.name: dynamicgroupfilter
properties.doc: The LDAP search filter Splunk uses when searching for dynamic groups

properties.name: dynamicmemberattribute
properties.doc: Only configure this if you intend to retrieve dynamic groups on your LDAP server

properties.name: groupnameattribute
properties.doc: This is the group entry attribute whose value stores the group name.

properties.name: groupmemberattribute
properties.doc: This is the group entry attribute whose values are the groups members

properties.name: nestedgroups
properties.doc: Controls whether Splunk will expand nested groups using the memberof extension.

properties.name: charset
properties.doc:
ONLY set this for an LDAP setup that returns non-UTF-8 encoded data. LDAP is supposed to always return UTF-8 encoded
data (See RFC 2251), but some tools incorrectly return other encodings.

properties.name: sizelimit
properties.doc: Limits the amount of entries we request in LDAP search

properties.name: timelimit
properties.doc: Limits the amount of time in seconds we will wait for an LDAP search request to complete

properties.name: network_timeout
properties.doc: Limits the amount of time a socket will poll a connection without activity

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: just a name

parameters.name: host
parameters.doc: the resolvable hostname server to be tested

parameters.name: port
parameters.doc: the resolvable hostname of the authentication server

properties.name: webport
properties.doc: the port on wich splunk web will be responding

properties.name: splunkport
properties.doc: the splunk management port

properties.name: minfreemb
properties.doc: sets the minimum amount of free space for the splund index data dir

properties.name: port
properties.doc: port where data is written to

parameters.name: forceindexpath
parameters.doc: force the change of index paths. This is leads to the loss of all data present in the index

parameters.name: indexname
parameters.doc: The name of the index

properties.name: coldpath
properties.doc: the path to the cold data

properties.name: thawedpath
properties.doc: the path to the thawed data

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: name of this license. This should correspond with the label found in the license file

parameters.name: hash
parameters.doc: license hash.. do not use

parameters.name: source
parameters.doc: license file to use for app. Must be splunk license file

parameters.name: tmp_fs
parameters.doc: temporary filesystem to use for app.

parameters.name: port
parameters.doc: the port the licensemaster is listening to

parameters.name: username
parameters.doc: splunk admin username to use

parameters.name: password
parameters.doc: valid password for the splunk admin user

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: monitor to manage from an apps inputs.conf file

properties.name: interval
properties.doc: the interval setting (applicable to script type monitors)

properties.name: source
properties.doc: the source setting for this monitor

properties.name: sourcetype
properties.doc: the sourcetype setting for this monitor

properties.name: index
properties.doc: the index setting for this monitor

parameters.name: role_name
parameters.doc: name of the role to implement

parameters.name: authentication_file
parameters.doc: location of the authentication file, the default value is /etc/splunk/system/local/authentication.conf. This depends on the link between /etc/splunk and $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/system

parameters.name: authorize_file
parameters.doc: location of the authorize file, the default value is /etc/splunk/system/local/authorize.conf. This depends on the link between /etc/splunk and $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/system

properties.name: role_map
properties.doc: ldap groups to map this role to

properties.name: importroles
properties.doc: array list of other roles and their associated capabilities that should be imported

properties.name: srchfilter
properties.doc: array list of search filters for this Role.

properties.name: srchtimewin
properties.doc: Maximum time span of a search, in seconds.

properties.name: srchdiskquota
properties.doc: Maximum amount of disk space (MB) that can be used by search jobs of a user that belongs to this role

properties.name: srchjobsquota
properties.doc: Maximum number of concurrently running historical searches a member of this role can have.

properties.name: rtsrchjobsquota
properties.doc: Maximum number of concurrently running real-time searches a member of this role can have.

properties.name: srchmaxtime
properties.doc: Maximum amount of time that searches of users from this role will be allowed to run.

properties.name: srchindexesdefault
properties.doc: array of indexes to search when no index is specified

properties.name: srchindexesallowed
properties.doc: array of indexes this role is allowed to search

properties.name: admin_all_objects
properties.doc: A role with this capability has access to objects in the system (user objects, search jobs, etc.)

properties.name: change_authentication
properties.doc: Required to change authentication settings through the various authentication endpoints.

properties.name: change_own_password
properties.doc: Self explanatory. Some auth systems prefer to have passwords be immutable for some users.

properties.name: delete_by_keyword
properties.doc: Required to use the delete search operator. Note that this does not actually delete the raw data on disk.

properties.name: edit_deployment_client
properties.doc: Self explanatory. The deployment client admin endpoint requires this cap for edit

properties.name: edit_dist_peer
properties.doc: Required to add and edit peers for distributed search

properties.name: edit_forwarders
properties.doc: Required to edit settings for forwarding data.

properties.name: edit_httpauths
properties.doc: Required to edit and end user sessions through the httpauth-tokens endpoint

properties.name: edit_input_defaults
properties.doc: Required to change the default hostname for input data in the server settings endpoint.

properties.name: edit_monitor
properties.doc: Required to add inputs and edit settings for monitoring files.

properties.name: edit_roles
properties.doc: Required to edit roles as well as change the mappings from users to roles.

properties.name: edit_scripted
properties.doc: Required to create and edit scripted inputs.

properties.name: edit_search_server
properties.doc: Required to edit general distributed search settings like timeouts, heartbeats, and blacklists

properties.name: edit_server
properties.doc: Required to edit general server settings such as the server name, log levels, etc.

properties.name: edit_splunktcp
properties.doc: Required to change settings for receiving TCP input from another Splunk instance.

properties.name: edit_splunktcp_ssl
properties.doc: Required to list or edit any SSL specific settings for Splunk TCP input.

properties.name: edit_tcp
properties.doc: Required to change settings for receiving general TCP inputs.

properties.name: edit_udp
properties.doc: Required to change settings for UDP inputs.

properties.name: edit_user
properties.doc: Required to create, edit, or remove users

properties.name: edit_web_settings
properties.doc: Required to change the settings for web.conf through the system settings endpoint.

properties.name: get_metadata
properties.doc: Required to change the settings for web.conf through the system settings endpoint.

properties.name: get_typeahead
properties.doc: Required for typeahead. This includes the typeahead endpoint and the typeahead search processor.

properties.name: input_file
properties.doc: Required for inputcsv (except for dispatch=t mode) and inputlookup

properties.name: indexes_edit
properties.doc: Required to change any index settings like file size and memory limits.

properties.name: license_tab
properties.doc: Required to access and change the license.

properties.name: list_forwarders
properties.doc: Required to show settings for forwarding data.

properties.name: list_httpauths
properties.doc: Required to list user sessions through the httpauth-tokens endpoint.

properties.name: list_inputs
properties.doc: Required to view the list of various inputs.

properties.name: output_file
properties.doc: Required for outputcsv (except for dispatch=t mode) and outputlookup

properties.name: request_remote_tok
properties.doc: Required to get a remote authentication token

properties.name: rest_apps_management
properties.doc: Required to edit settings for entries and categories in the python remote apps handler.

properties.name: rest_apps_view
properties.doc: Required to list various properties in the python remote apps handler.

properties.name: rest_properties_get
properties.doc: Required to get information from the services/properties endpoint.

properties.name: rest_properties_set
properties.doc: Required to edit the services/properties endpoint.

properties.name: restart_splunkd
properties.doc: Required to restart Splunk through the server control handler.

properties.name: rtsearch
properties.doc: Required to run a realtime search.

properties.name: run_debug_commands
properties.doc: Required to run debugging commands like summarize

properties.name: schedule_search
properties.doc: Required to schedule saved searches.

properties.name: search
properties.doc: Self explanatory - required to run a search.

properties.name: use_file_operator
properties.doc: Required to use the file search operator.

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: monitor to manage from an apps inputs.conf file

parameters.name: remoteuser
parameters.doc: the username to use in communication to the remote server

parameters.name: remotepassword
parameters.doc: the password to use in the communication to the remote server

properties.name: port
properties.doc: the index where the data is written to

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: the splunk uri for the port. Must look like tcp://:portnr or tcp:/<hostname>/:portnumber

properties.name: connection_host
properties.doc:
* "ip" sets the host to the IP address of the system sending the data. 
    * "dns" sets the host to the reverse DNS entry for IP address of the system sending the data.
    * "none" leaves the host as specified in inputs.conf, typically the splunk system hostname.
    * Defaults to "ip".

properties.name: enables2sheartbeat
properties.doc:
* This specifies the keepalive setting for the splunktcp port.
    * This option is used to detect forwarders which may have become unavailable due to network, firewall, etc., problems.
    * Splunk will monitor the connection for presence of heartbeat, and if the heartbeat is not seen for 
      s2sHeartbeatTimeout seconds, it will close the connection.
    * This overrides the default value specified at the global [splunktcp] stanza.

properties.name: s2sheartbeatTimeout
properties.doc: heartbeat timeout in seconds

properties.name: compressed
properties.doc:
* Specifies whether receiving compressed data.
    * If set to true, the forwarder port must also have compression turned on.

properties.name: inputshutdowntimeout
properties.doc:
Used during shutdown to minimize data loss when forwarders are connected to a receiver. 
      During shutdown, the tcp input processor waits for the specified number of seconds and then 
      closes any remaining open connections. If, however, all connections close before the end of 
      the timeout period, shutdown proceeds immediately, without waiting for the timeout.

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: the splunk uri for the port. Must look like tcp://:portnr or tcp:/<hostname>/:portnumber

properties.name: index
properties.doc: the index where the data is written to

properties.name: source
properties.doc: the source of the incomming data

properties.name: sourcetype
properties.doc: the sourcetype of the incomming data

properties.name: connection_host
properties.doc: how to set the hostname data

properties.name: queue
properties.doc: how to set the hostname data

properties.name: queuesize
properties.doc: how to set the hostname data

properties.name: persistentqueuesize
properties.doc: how to set the hostname data

properties.name: requireheader
properties.doc: how to set the hostname data

properties.name: listenonipv6
properties.doc: how to set the hostname data

properties.name: acceptfrom
properties.doc: how to set the hostname data

properties.name: rawtcpdonetimeout
properties.doc: how to set the hostname data

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: the splunk uri for the port. Must look like tcp://:portnr or tcp:/<hostname>/:portnumber

properties.name: index
properties.doc: the index where the data is written to

properties.name: source
properties.doc: the source of the incomming data

properties.name: sourcetype
properties.doc: the sourcetype of the incomming data
